articles.author: Maggie Fick
articles.description: A world-renowned U.S. program for international disaster and crisis assistance can no longer deploy in the event of a major emergency due to the Trump administration's dismantling of the U.S. foreign aid agency, nine sources with knowledge of the matter told Reuters.
articles.title: Exclusive: US global disaster response teams unable to deploy following USAID shutdown, sources say

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Rwandan-backed M23 rebels entered eastern Democratic Republic of Congo's second-largest city Bukavu on Friday, a rebel leader told Reuters, as residents reported seeing the militants in the streets of a northern district.
articles.title: Congo rebels say they have entered Bukavu after seizing airport

articles.author: Trevor Hunnicutt, Kanishka Singh
articles.description: President Donald Trump on Friday advocated taking a "hard stance" on Gaza, the Palestinian enclave for which he has proposed a U.S. takeover and where a fragile ceasefire between Israel and Palestinian Hamas militants is in place.
articles.title: Trump backs 'hard stance' on Gaza, says he does not know what Israel will do

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The world's chemical weapons watchdog on Friday said it had once again found traces of tear gas on the frontline with Russia in Ukraine's central-east Dnipropetrovsk region.
articles.title: New traces of tear gas found on Ukraine battlefield by chemical weapons watchdog

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: One of the Taiwan air force's new, domestically developed advanced jet trainer aircraft crashed on Saturday after reporting engine failure, though the crew safely bailed out, the military said, in a setback for the programme.
articles.title: Advanced new Taiwan jet trainer crashes in setback for programme

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: North Korea said on Saturday that the United States should abandon military threats if it has concerns about its mainland safety, state media KCNA reported, citing an official at North Korea's defence ministry.
articles.title: North Korea says U.S. should abandon military threats, KCNA says

articles.author: Nandita Bose, Doina Chiacu
articles.description: U.S. Vice President JD Vance on Friday took a swipe at European governments for what he described as their censorship of free speech and their political opponents, while largely avoiding the question of how to resolve the Ukraine war.
articles.title: In Munich, Vance accuses European politicians of censoring free speech

articles.author: Joey Roulette
articles.description: The National Transportation Safety Board is examining "bad data" the crew of an Army Black Hawk helicopter may have relied upon prior to its deadly crash with a passenger jet outside Washington D.C. late last month, an official said.
articles.title: US probing 'bad data' possibly used by Black Hawk crew before deadly crash, official says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Pope Francis was taken to hospital on Friday morning for tests and to continue treatment of his ongoing bronchitis, the Vatican said.
articles.title: Pope Francis taken to hospital for bronchitis treatment

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Western Australia's ports of Dampier and Varanus Island reopened, the ports' operator said, after Tropical Cyclone Zelia hit the state's Pilbara iron ore region on Friday.
articles.title: Two ports in Western Australia's Pilbara region reopen after Tropical Cyclone Zelia
